description: System-generated unique identifier for the vendor record (primary key).
Date-time the vendor record was last created or updated, stored as yyyymmddhhmmssSSS.
Indicates whether the vendor is inactive and should not be used.
Vendor weekend operating hours; likely open/close times or free-text notes; confirm with SME.
Vendor weekday operating hours; likely open/close times or free-text notes; confirm with SME.
Mobile phone number for the vendor’s primary contact.
Fax number for the vendor.
Alternate phone number for the vendor or contact.
Primary business phone number for the vendor.
Postal/ZIP code for the vendor’s address; may include 5 or 9 digits.
City for the vendor’s mailing or physical address.
Secondary address line (suite, unit, PO Box, or additional routing info).
Primary street address for the vendor location.
Contact last name; may contain a full name in some records; confirm with SME.
Contact first name; sometimes populated with a company name; confirm with SME.
Legal or trade name of the vendor company.
Free-text notes about the vendor (e.g., brand affiliation or special instructions).
Default fuel tax rate applied to fuel purchases from this vendor; confirm with SME.
Organization-assigned vendor number or account code used for identification and billing.
Primary contact email address; may occasionally store a website instead; confirm with SME.
State/province code for the vendor address (likely a numeric foreign key); confirm with SME.
Lookup reference or label associated with the state code, used by UI/reporting; confirm with SME.
Code indicating vendor type or category (e.g., fuel, parts, services); confirm with SME.
Lookup reference/label for the vendor type code; confirm with SME.
Vendor website URL.
Identifier of this vendor in a legacy system for migration or cross-reference.
Name of the legacy source table from which this record originated.
Code for agreed payment terms (e.g., Net 30); confirm with SME.
Lookup reference/label for the payment terms code; confirm with SME.
Default sales or service tax percentage applied to purchases from this vendor.
Location or site name associated with the vendor account (specific branch or agency).
Indicates whether a formal contract is required before purchasing from this vendor.
Code identifying the vendor’s chain or parent brand affiliation; confirm with SME.
Lookup reference/label for the vendor chain code; confirm with SME.
External map URL linking to the vendor’s address for driving directions.
Count of core items pending return/credit with this vendor and not yet processed; confirm with SME.
